Testing directives in e2e

List of all the test pages for the angular components

{{componentName}} page

Configuration

Edit app.js

You need to go to app.js and add your component name to the router array: [.. other components .., '{{main.componentName}}'].forEach(

Add the following files

You need to add these files to your project:

views/test-component-page/{{main.componentName}}-page.html - This is your html test page

test/e2e/spec/{{main.componentName}}.js - This is your spec page

main-page.js

Use test/e2e/pages/main-page.js to set up your component object (you can copy from other examples)

Adding scope parameters

Go to app/scripts/controllers/main.js and add this variable on your scope:

this.{{main.camelCase(main.componentName)}} = { yourKey: yourValue }

Then you can use your parameter in your html file:

<{{main.componentName}} some-attribute="main.{{main.camelCase(main.componentName)}}"><{{main.componentName}}>

View Directive page

Now you can route to /#/test-component-page/{{main.componentName}} to check your component.

How to use mainPage model to navigate to your component

You can easily use this method to see your component: mainPage.navigateToDirective('{{main.componentName}}');
